thread.title_full: Salman Khan to undergo massive transformation for 'Tiger Zinda Hai'? Here's what you should know | Zee News

title: Salman Khan to undergo massive transformation for 'Tiger Zinda Hai'? Here's what you should know | Zee News
text:
Salman Khan to undergo massive transformation for 'Tiger Zinda Hai'? Here's what you should know By Ritika Handoo | Last Updated: Thursday, February 23, 2017 - 13:00 0 Follow @ZeeNews 
New Delhi: Superstar Salman Khan's next film after Kabir Khan's 'Tubelight' happens to be Ali Abbas Zafar's 'Tiger Zinda Hai'. The film brings back the magical jodi of Katrina Kaif and Salman Khan on-screen. 
'Tiger Zinda Hai' is creating the right kind of buzz around it. Reason? Well, what bigger reason that brand Salman Khan. The superstar recently attended an event where filmmaker Mahesh Manjrekar was also present, but what caught everyone's attention was the different look sported by Sallu bhai . MUST READ Salman Khan and Katrina Kaif's 'Tiger Zinda Hai' costumes REVEALED? 
Several pictures of the superstar Khan from the event went viral making us wonder if this perhaps happens to be his 'Tiger Zinda Hai' look. Well, interestingly, one of his fan clubs on Twitter shared some of the pictures and you check them out for yourselves. Salman Khan @BeingSalmanKhan in Tiger Zinda Hai Look pic.twitter.com/I1MtMCVok4 
— Salman Khan Universe (@salmanuniv) February 23, 2017 
Also, another bit of information shared by the fan club left us surprised. The superstar is reportedly going to undergo massive body transformation as he will lose as many as 17 kgs for the film. Salman Khan @BeingSalmanKhan to lose 17 kg of weight for Tiger Zinda Hai! 
— Salman Khan Universe (@salmanuniv) February 22, 2017 
Yes! The Salman Khan fan club claims that the actor will lose this much weight for the film. 'Tiger Zinda Hai' happens to be the sequel of 2012 superhit flick 'Ek Tha Tiger' which was helmed by Kabir Khan. It will be produced by Yash Raj Films. 
Are you excited? First Published: Thursday, February 23, 2017 - 12:55 More from zeenews
